Articles.Content:
Hi!

I am sorry for the shameless self-promoting, but i made a small game in unity to learn and practice the navigation in space, and i thought i'd share it here. The game is much closer to the community of KSP than the community of casual gamers

Play Learning Gravity!

I hope i will find some competitors here, as so far my own scores are much better than any of the other players

Cheers
Looks great. Some orbital mechanics aren't as... real as you would expect, but it's understandable when you're thrusting into the sun at t x200.
Says I need unity web player which I have...

Looks great. Some orbital mechanics aren't as... real as you would expect, but it's understandable when you're thrusting into the sun at t x200.

The mechanics are real, but the planets and moons are much closer to eachother in distance and mass, so the gameplay is faster and the maneuvers are more interesting

Awesome little thing, very Kerbal-like. I can imagine Jeb just holding down left mouse button as he burns towards the Sun yelling "M0AR B00STERS!!" while sitting in his craft, waiting for Duna rendezvous or something.
Fun little game, also gave me some ideas for something I'm working on. The projected paths by "object of influence" are quite smart.
Very good game, great for learning orbital mechanics.
